item.title: Codelco-SQM 合资企业瞄准锂矿开采的制高点
item.description: 智利金属巨头 Codelco 公司和锂生产商 SQM 公司的合资企业旨在成为世界上最大的电池金属生产商，依靠低成本、低影响的生产来满足日益增长的需求。【原文：A joint venture between Chilean metal giant Codelco and lithium producer SQM aims to become the world’s largest producer the battery metal, banking on low-cost, low-impact production to tap growing demand.】

item.title: 雪佛龙公司船只在美国港口卸载委内瑞拉石油，抵御封锁
item.description: 据彭博社查阅的数据显示，自特朗普政府发起部分海上封锁以来，至少有两艘由雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp.）租用的从委内瑞拉运油的船只在美国港口成功卸货。【原文：At least two vessels chartered by Chevron Corp. that picked up oil from Venezuela since the Trump administration launched a partial maritime blockade have successfully unloaded cargoes at US ports, according to data reviewed by Bloomberg.】

item.title: 特朗普时代与华盛顿通道有关的 "骗局 "ETF碰壁
item.description: 华尔街价值 13 万亿美元的 ETF 机器今年突破了界限，不断推出风险更大的产品，以满足迷恋收益、杠杆和新奇的散户交易者的需求。【原文：Wall Street’s $13 trillion ETF machine pushed boundaries this year, cranking out ever-riskier products to feed retail traders hooked on yield, leverage and novelty.】

item.title: 国债波动率将创 2009 年以来最大年度跌幅
item.description: 由于美联储降息抑制了经济下滑的风险，衡量美国债券市场波动性的一项指标将创下金融危机以来的最大年度跌幅。【原文：A measure of US bond-market volatility is heading for its biggest annual decline since the wake of the financial crisis with the Federal Reserve’s interest-rate cuts dampening risks of an economic downturn.】

item.title: 人工智能推动了今年价值 700 亿美元的数据中心并购交易
item.description: 人工智能的蓬勃发展已经吸引了数千亿美元的融资、融资轮和合作伙伴关系，这也推动了一波数据中心收购谈判。【原文：The artificial intelligence boom — which has already attracted hundreds of billions of dollars in financing, funding rounds and partnerships — is driving a wave of data center takeover talks, too.】

item.title: 美联储研究发现：调查数据夸大了移民人数的下降
item.description: 根据圣路易斯联邦储备银行的一项新的分析，衡量移民人口减少的政府数据被夸大了，这很可能是由于愿意参加调查的移民人数减少了。【原文：Government data measuring declines in the immigrant population are overstated likely due to a drop in the number of immigrants willing to participate in surveys, according to a new analysis from the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis.】

item.title: 关注中国粮食储备，玉米创一个月来最大跌幅
item.description: 周一，玉米创下一个多月来的最大盘中跌幅，带动谷物期货下跌，因为交易商在寻求需求信号，以打破市场的假期低迷状态。【原文：Corn’s biggest intraday losses in over a month paced declines in grain futures Monday as traders sought demand signals to break markets out of their holiday doldrums.】

item.title: 2025 年是市场奇异的一年
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 纽约市破产出租大楼获得峰会 4.51 亿美元报价
item.description: 法庭文件显示，房地产公司 Summit Properties USA 已达成一项价值 4.51 亿美元的交易，将收购纽约市数十栋由当前所有者 Pinnacle Group 破产的公寓楼。【原文：Real estate firm Summit Properties USA has struck a $451 million deal to acquire dozens of New York City apartment buildings put into bankruptcy by current owner Pinnacle Group, according to court papers.】

item.title: 美国待售房屋销量跃升至 2023 年初以来最高水平
item.description: 由于价格和抵押贷款利率略有提高，购房者受到鼓舞，11 月份美国现房待售量的攀升幅度超过预期。【原文：Pending sales of US existing homes climbed by more than expected in November as a modest improvement in prices and mortgage rates encouraged buyers.】

item.title: 风险厌恶情绪冲击大型科技股，提振能源股，美股下滑
item.description: 由于交易商对资产波动和地缘政治紧张局势的不安情绪加剧，周一开盘时 S&P 500 指数下跌。英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）和帕兰提尔科技公司（Palantir Technologies Inc.【原文：The S&P 500 Index fell at the open on Monday amid traders’ intensifying unease about volatile asset moves and geopolitical tensions. Nvidia Corp. and Palantir Technologies Inc. were among the top decliners by volume as the two were featured in stories wrapping the biggest trades of the year.】

item.title: Blackstone 旗下 AirTrunk 探索新加坡房地产投资信托基金 IPO
item.description: 熟悉此事的人士称，Blackstone Inc. 在 2024 年创纪录的交易中收购的澳大利亚数据中心运营商 AirTrunk 正在考虑各种选择，包括在新加坡上市的潜在房地产投资信托。【原文：AirTrunk, the Australian data-center operator that Blackstone Inc. bought in a record 2024 deal, is considering options including a potential real estate investment trust listing in Singapore, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: Airbus Wins $8 Billion in Aircraft Orders From Chinese Airlines
item.description: Airbus SE landed orders for dozens of aircraft from two Chinese carriers as the European planemaker grows its market share in Asia’s biggest economy.

item.title: SoftBank Agrees to Buy DigitalBridge for $4 Billion
item.description: SoftBank Group Corp. agreed to acquire private equity firm DigitalBridge Group Inc. in a deal valuing the data center investor at $4 billion including debt.

item.title: This Year’s IPO Billionaires See Wealth Eroded by Market Moves
item.description: The long-awaited return of IPO activity this year minted 21 new billionaires, but what came after many companies’ eye-popping debuts was often a different story.

item.title: Copper Rally Boosts Zambia’s Kwacha as Africa Gains from Commodities
item.description: Zambia’s kwacha rose, joining a rally in the currencies of other African metal producers, as a surge in the price of copper promises to boost export earnings.

item.title: Canada Pensions Overseeing $1.2 Trillion Revamp Private Equity Model
item.description: For the likes of Blackstone Inc. and KKR & Co., a multibillion-dollar opportunity beckons from Canada.

item.title: Nvidia, Lenovo and Samsung to Test Consumer Appetite for AI at CES
item.description: At CES, the annual consumer technology conference happening in Las Vegas next week, the biggest names in tech, including Nvidia Corp., Advanced Micro Devices Inc., Samsung Electronics Co. and Lenovo Group Ltd., will make the case for artificial intelligence. Their target audience those few days: investors, corporate clients and — perhaps just as importantly — ordinary shoppers who have yet to be fully sold on the idea of AI-infused gadgets.

item.title: Bahrain Unveils Package of Reforms to Fight Fiscal Woes
item.description: Bahrain approved fiscal reforms including changes to corporate income tax and spending cuts as the island nation seeks to curb rising debt levels and budget deficits.

item.title: Publicly Traded Private-Credit Funds Set for Worst Year Since 2020
item.description: Business development companies are set for their worst year relative to the S&P 500 since 2020, leading some investors to question their future in the $1.7 trillion private credit market.

item.title: 名不见经传的芯片制造商的需求是人工智能长远发展的关键
item.description: 欢迎收看《深度科技》（Tech In Depth），这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日通讯。今天，在我们展望2026年科技趋势的第二篇报道中，伊恩-金（Ian King）写道，与关注市场领头羊英伟达（Nvidia）相比，关注那些不太引人注意的芯片制造商可能是评估人工智能未来的更好方法。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, in the second installment of our reports looking ahead to tech trends in 2026, Ian King writes that watching the less-publicized chipmakers may be a better way of assessing the future of artificial intelligence than keeping an eye on market leader Nvidia.】

item.title: 中美两国在脆弱的贸易休战中迈向 2026 年
item.description: 特朗普和习近平在关税问题上斡旋达成停火协议，但在台湾和稀土等问题上的紧张局势正在加剧【原文：Trump and Xi have brokered a ceasefire on tariffs, but tension is flaring up on issues like Taiwan and rare earths】

item.title: 廉价牛肉的最后堡垒在最新的平价威胁中逐渐消失
item.description: 廉价牛肉可能很快会变得更加遥不可及。巴西是世界上仅存的几个丰富的牛源之一，但它正步入供应萎缩期，这可能会推高全球牛肉价格。【原文：Cheap beef may soon become further out of reach. Brazil, one of the world’s few remaining sources of abundant cattle, is heading into a period of shrinking supplies that could push global prices higher.】

item.title: 只有牛市：每一位华尔街分析师现在都预测股市将反弹
item.description: 在大银行和精品投资店里，一种乐观的共识已经形成：2026 年美国股市将连续第四年上涨，创下近二十年来最长的连涨纪录。【原文：At the big banks and the boutique investment shops, an optimistic consensus has taken hold: the US stock market will rally in 2026 for a fourth straight year, marking the longest winning streak in nearly two decades.】

item.title: 沙特失业率连续第二年攀升，经济遭受重创
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯的失业率自 2018 年以来首次连续两个季度上升，这预示着在王储穆罕默德-本-萨勒曼努力实现经济转型的同时，劳动力状况也更加严峻。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s unemployment rate rose for two consecutive quarters for the first time since 2018, signaling more challenging labor conditions as Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman strives to transform the economy.】

item.title: 空中客车公司快速生产飞机以实现交付目标
item.description: 据熟悉情况的人士透露，空中客车公司（Airbus SE）在今年的最后几天正在快速生产飞机，这家欧洲飞机制造商对实现几周前被迫削减的交付目标信心倍增。【原文：Airbus SE is churning out aircraft at a rapid clip in the final days of the year, with confidence building at the European planemaker that it can achieve the delivery goal it was forced to cut only a few weeks ago, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 为什么白银价格比黄金价格上涨得更快
item.description: 2025 年，随着美国特朗普政府非正统的经济政策让投资者和央行纷纷寻求避险资产，黄金上演了戏剧性的反弹。但现在，白银正在成为焦点。【原文：Gold staged a dramatic rally in 2025 as the US Trump administration’s unorthodox economic policies sent investors and central banks reaching for safe-haven assets. Right now, however, it’s silver that’s stealing the spotlight.】

回顾本年度的一些著名交易。【原文：

A look at some of the year’s notable trades.

item.title: 阿联酋矿商 Axis 在几内亚铝土矿争端中索赔 289 亿美元
item.description: 一家总部设在阿拉伯联合酋长国的公司声称自己是几内亚第二大铝土矿生产商，该公司向西非国家提出 289 亿美元的索赔，要求取消其采矿权。【原文：A United Arab Emirates-based company that says it is Guinea’s second-largest bauxite producer filed a $28.9 billion claim against the West African nation for revoking its mining rights.】

item.title: 越南国家银行警告流动性短缺和关税压力
item.description: 越南央行警告说，在 2025 年银行贷款猛增五分之一之后，一些贷款机构正面临流动性短缺问题，并补充说外部因素将使政府的经济目标进一步复杂化。【原文：Vietnam’s central bank warned some lenders are facing liquidity shortages after bank loans jumped a fifth in 2025, adding that external factors will further complicate the government’s economic targets.】
